title: Dave McCall
text:
Dave McCall (born 15 April 1987) is a former <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20sevens%20team">Scotland 7s</a> international <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player, previously with <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow Warriors</a> and <a href="Edinburgh%20Rugby">Edinburgh</a>.
Rugby Union career.
Amateur career.
He started with <a href="Stewart%27s%20Melville%20RFC">Stewart's Melville</a>, where he impressed, becoming an apprentice at Edinburgh Rugby.
He played for <a href="Heriot%27s%20Rugby%20Club">Heriots</a> while at Edinburgh University. He won Man of the Match in the Scottish Cup final of 2007 in Heriots match against <a href="Melrose%20RFC">Melrose</a>. In his first season with Glasgow Warriors he was also assigned to Heriots in the Pro Player Draft.
In 2010-11 season he was assigned to <a href="Melrose%20RFC">Melrose</a> in the draft.
At the start of 2011-12 season he was assigned to <a href="Glasgow%20Hawks%20RFC">Glasgow Hawks</a>. However by the end of 2011, he had moved to England.
Professional career.
He played for <a href="Edinburgh%20Rugby">Edinburgh</a> from 2005 to 2007. When Edinburgh was taken from the Bob Carruthers run franchise back into the SRU's hands McCall was released in a cost-cutting measure.
On the back of his Scottish Cup final performance for Heriots Glasgow Warriors boss <a href="Sean%20Lineen">Sean Lineen</a> offered McCall a training contract. He played for <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow Warriors</a> from 2009 to 2011, making his contract full time in 2010. He has the <a href="List%20of%20Glasgow%20Warriors%20players">Warrior No. 176</a>.
He moved to Rotherham at the end of 2011 and played for <a href="Rotherham%20Titans">Rotherham Titans</a> from 2011 to 2012.
He played for <a href="London%20Scottish%20F.C.">London Scottish</a> from 2012 to 2013.
International career.
He was capped by <a href="Scotland%20national%20under-19%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland U19s</a>.
He was also capped by <a href="Scotland%20Club%20XV">Scotland Club XV</a>.
He has been capped by <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20sevens%20team">Scotland 7s</a>.
